subtitle: They help you stay well
title: Why do I need regular checkups?
content:
Created by BabyCenter


When you are pregnant, it is a good idea to have regular check-ups by a healthcare provider. It is best to have at least 5 visits while you are pregnant. Try to schedule the first visit just after you have missed your period. 

Here is why regular checkups make sense:

•	At the checkup, a healthcare provider will do tests to make sure that you and your baby are well.

•	If there are problems when you are pregnant, your healthcare provider will find them early. This will give you the best chance of getting the right treatment so you and your baby are healthy.

•	If you have questions about your pregnancy, your healthcare provider is the best person to ask. She will answer your questions and will give you the right information.

•	You will feel reassured your baby is growing well.

Find out how to get to your nearest healthcare provider or to your local hospital or birth center. Talk to your family about why you need to visit regularly during pregnancy. Ask them for help if you need transportation. 

If you are worried, ask the father of your baby or another family member, or a trusted friend to go with you. If it is a long way, you may want to carry some food and drinking water with you.

[What to expect at your prenatal visits][1]


  [1]: http://www.babycenter.com/0_what-to-expect-at-your-prenatal-visits_9252.bc
